results.title: A Race of horses
results.creator_credit: Kit Denton, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.

results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.

results.title: A Quiet Place
results.brief_description: A family is forced to live in silence while hiding from creatures that hunt by sound.

constellations_other.name: Significant sounds
constellations_other.description: The arrival of synchronised sound dramatically changed the movie business, allowing filmmakers to use sound in new and exciting ways which developed the use sound into own film language.

results.title: A Question of time
results.creator_credit: Don Levy, Stephen Toulmin, Judy Goodfield and Nuffield Foundation
results.brief_description: Treats in a new cinematic manner man’s unequal struggle to gain an intellectual grasp on the idea of time, its origin, measurement and place in theoretical physics. An exploration of the concept of time reduced to a human scale and ranging through the major historical developments; mans first notion of time; its relation to movement and more recent concepts of biological time, time in relativistic terms.

results.title: A Question of may
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Communicating”.
A corporate training film on the nature and importance of effective communication skills within the work place. A mock training session is intercut with dramatic situations depicting the problems of miscommunication.

results.title: A Question of Balance
results.brief_description: This program looks at the issue of woodchipping and forestry management in Australia, with special emphasis on the South East Forest region of Victoria and NSW, and asks the question…What’s it worth to disrupt the balance? With the advent of the Greenhouse Effect it is now imperative that we look carefully and critically at how we manage our environment.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this visit to Taiwan Ronald Eyre looks at Chinese religion and finds that the Chinese are Confucians, Taoists, Buddhists or can be all three at once. He explores the concept of yin and yan and the harmony which comes when good and evil are combined in balance. He takes his journey from a look at the local gods to the philosophy of the three accepted religions. The three main aims of the Chinese seem to be to live a long time, to have enough money and to have children, and it is from this that the importance of ancestors derive. He attends a village opera performance, a taoist funeral and explores a new temple which seems to include all three religions.
